name: 賴冠廷
objective: The goal of this course is to give students a broad overview of state-of-the-art deep learning algorithms, and teach students how to develop deep learning applications by hands-on coding examples. Most examples taught in this class are based on the TensorFlow framework. We will cover many different fields including image classification, object detection, natural language processing, reinforcement learning and generative adversarial networks.
schedule:
Course website: http://www.aiotlab.org/teaching/dl_app.html

1.	Introduction to Deep Learning
2.	Applied Math (Linear Algebra, Probability, Calculus)
3.	Machine Learning Basics
4.	TensorFlow & Keras        
5.	Convolutional Neural Networks  (CNN)      
6.	Advanced Keras API & PyTorch
7.	Natural Language Processing (NLP), Word Embedding, Self-supervised Learning
8.	Midterm exam
9.	Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN) & Long Short-term Memory (LSTM)
10.	Attention is all you need! Attention and Transformer
11.	Foundation Models, ChatGPT, and Hugging Face
12.	Object Detection and Segmentation
13.	Generative Adversarial Networks (GAN)
14.	Diffusion is all you need? Stable diffusion, midjourney, DALL-E
15.	Deep Reinforcement Learning and Stable Baseline
16.	Graph Convolution Networks (GCN)
17.	Final project demo
18.	Final exam
scorePolicy: Homework (40%), Midterm and Final Exam (35%), Final Project (15%), Quizzes and attendance (10%)
materials:
1. Francois Chollet, “Deep Learning with Python, 2nd edition” Manning, 2021
2. Ian Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, and Aaron Courville, “Deep Learning,” MIT Press, 2017
3. Latest publications on CVPR, NIPS, ICML, AAAI, ICLR

Website: http://www.aiotlab.org/teaching/dl_app.html
